intro: Macrorhamnus louvelii, commonly known as the Madagascar star-apple, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, with the showy structures being modified leaves called bracts.
